positive.review:
In my fifteen-year career as a professional Truck Wrangler at the Alabama Trucker's Home in Virginia, I have never been so DISGUSTED in my entire life by a sickening MOCKERY of a game as this one.

Firstly, a minor irritation, when designing the company logo at the start of the game, there was no 'swastika' option. Disappointing.

First of all, the TRUCKS. Oh boy, the trucks... it you can call them that. I've seen better trucks tumble out of a gypsy's tattered backside than some of the 'trucks' on this game. I mean, what were the developers thinking with this? It simply *boggles* the mind, to quote a great author.

Secondly, the EURO aspect of the game left me sorely disappointed. I mean, not one mention of God's glorious U S of A was mentioned in the game. I know, strictly speaking, the US isnt in Europe, but given the sheer size of the States, and the grand number of trucks teeming within it's borders, surely that's a perfect opportunity to fly the stars and stripes and give a nod to the Original Truckers - us guys.

Thirdly, the in-game radio is SHAMBOLIC. I mean, Only 3 country stations to choose from? Who do they think I am? If I wanted to listen to opera singing I'd just KICK a CAT or something. Disgraceful!

And the controls. Jesus Christ almighty, I have never struggled to drive a truck before. In my years before the truck-cident that claimed most of my legs, I was able to drive from Alaska to Hawaii every morning and night, up-hill both ways, without so much as braking (HA what a pun) a sweat. But now in this game, it's a miracle if I can get the truck out of the parking lot. Then the fact that I was forced to drive on the wrong, most un-American side of the road. Blasphemy!

In summary, 8/10 a MUST RECOMMEND A+ **** 56% this game might just be the biggest mistake you ever make. Peace out and God Bless x

This game is relaxing but cool in it's own way. Also there are plenty of modifications!!! 10/10

One of the most realistic games I have ever played. It's not realistic just because of graphics but also because of the good AI. It might even be better than 18 Wheels of Steel Extreme Trucker 2, one of SCS software's fantastic games.

One of the best driving simulations I have played, the level of detail is simply stunning and the amount of roads you get to drive is mind boggling. The ability to drive from Glasgow to Germany is amazing and I'd highly recommend a good audio book when doing the run. ü•á

I think this game is one of the most amazing games I have ever played mainly because I didn't think I would even like it, but too my surprise I do a lot!
I admittedly have only been playing the demo but you can play it enough to get a proper idea of the game.
In short you play a truck driver with options to work for companies and you deliver their goods all over europe and uk, after a while when you make enough money you can open your own business and buy your own truck so you are in effect working for yourself which isnt as easy as working for a company as you have to pay for everything yourself such as repairs.
Driving is realistic with good graphic quality, traffic acts naturally ,the controls are easy to use after a bit but if you have a steering wheel and pedals I soppose it would be even better ! { guess what my new xmas present is lol }
I play on a lap top and use mouse and buttons at the mo but have managed very well after a few incidents that have seen me stuck on the top of a car or two but on the whole I am getting better :)
I will be buying the game for sure I have been playing single player and havn't got bored, also nice sound effects all in all a nice realistic simulation game.
Give the demo a go if your unsure it helps a lot to see if you are going to be suited to it.

I'll consider purchasing when it comes down in price.

4/5 Stars. Grab the demo; I got 8 hours of gameplay from that. Graphics are good, controls are okay if you're a keyboarder. I read that people with game controllers and PC steering wheel hardware find it easier to manipulate the steering.
Lovely graphics, variable weather, 1 minute of in-game travel time takes 2 seconds of real time. This sim is excellent because (unlike city-building or character sims) you can play this one for 30 min and then, when your current shipping contract is complete, walk away to make dinner.
It didn't get 5/5 from me because the demo didn't take me to the point where I could start my own shipping company or buy my own truck. After experiencing about 30% of what's possible in this game, I can't give it the 5/5 that I suspect it so richly deserves.

negative.review: Played the demo briefly, as you might tell from the time I played.  I had to delete the demo from my machine as it kept crashing the dx on my machine.  I like the game and the whole idea however, first real trip and somehow on a flat straight stretch of road the truck flips on its side.  Okay I'm doing 90 on a highway, I didn't hit anything and I had no chance to brake to stop.  So call for help.  Now I'm at the service centre now where do I go... never mind crashed again.  Hopefully you have better luck.  I think I will stay away for awhile.  I really wanted to play this too.

Unless you are really, really into Sim games, I don't recommend it,Downloaded it thinking it could be an interesting experience, even though i do not own a wheel controller...but it was boring, the only challenge I had was trying to park the truck, which is almost impossible and frustrating[at least using my x360 controller].Plus, the graphics could be a differential and make the game worth it, but they're dissapointing even with the max sets.Obs:Don't even dream about using mouse/keyboard.

I like the game and the whole idea however, first real trip and somehow on a flat straight stretch of road the truck flips on its side.  Okay I'm doing 90 on a highway, I didn't hit anything and I had no chance to brake to stop.  So call for help.  Now I'm at the service centre now where do I go... never mind crashed again.  Hopefully you have better luck.  I think I will stay away for awhile.  I really wanted to play this too.

Unless you are really, really into Sim games, I don't recommend it,Downloaded it thinking it could be an interesting experience, even though i do not own a wheel controller...but it was boring, the only challenge I had was trying to park the truck, which is almost impossible and frustrating[at least using my x360 controller].Plus, the graphics could be a differential and make the game worth it, but they're dissapointing even with the max sets.Obs:Don't even dream about using mouse/keyboard.
THis game is booring and the graphics suck. Don't buy
